meanings.definition: Unable to be taken away or transferred.
meanings.sent1: The inalienability rights of citizens are protected by law.
meanings.sent2: The inalienability of her ownership of the house was unquestionable.
meanings.sent3: The inalienability of the magic potion made for a humorous situation in the story.
meanings.sent4: The inalienability of his love for her was as solid as a rock.
meanings.sent5: The inalienability of the treasure map's location was crucial for the adventure.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unable to be surrendered or transferred.
meanings.sent1: The inalienability of the land ensured its protection for generations.
meanings.sent2: The inalienability of the contract made negotiations difficult.
meanings.sent3: The inalienability of the last piece of cake led to a friendly argument.
meanings.sent4: The inalienability of her loyalty shone through in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The inalienability of the ancient artifact's origin added to its mystique.
